name: Buena Vista Luxury Villas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Given all the positive reviews here, my expectations were reasonably high for our 3 day trip in late April. We stayed in a villa, and overall thought the property was OK but would not return. Some key points:
reviews.title: Nice rooms, poor service, not a great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) The room itself was fine, though lacking some amenities one would expect at the prices charged (e.g. no iron in the room, no robes offered).
reviews.title: Peaceful and beautiful property and beach

likes.liked: — the surrounding vegetation and wildlife, the beach, the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: 2) They ask you not to put used toilet paper in the toilet, but rather to put it in the open garbage can next to the toilet. This was disgusting and inappropriate for a property at this price level (~$600/night for a 2 bedroom villa). They should install working septic systems if that is the issue.
reviews.title: Terrific Place, We would definitely come back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3) The service is well-intentioned but bad. There is no front desk; everything you need goes through an overworked "concierge" assigned to your room. The staff were very nice and accommodating, but clearly overworked. There are just too many rooms for each concierge to handle, and the service suffers as a consequence.
reviews.title: Great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: 4) The property is spread along a very steep hill, running from the road at the top to the beach below. They do have a car that can drive you around, but using it involves long waits and sometimes multiple calls to the above-mentioned (overworked) concierges. Walking is fine if you are in good physical shape, but the hills are quite steep so it does require some effort.
reviews.title: Great service

likes.disliked: — no internet access in the villas

reviews.text: Every morning while we would drink our delicious costa rican coffee a band of monkeys would come right up to our balcony. It was a surreal experience.

reviews.text: You are right in the heart of the jungle yet at the same time experiencing the peak of luxury. The Casas also have exclusive access to multiple pools and a private beach. We could barely bring ourselves
reviews.title: Worth EVERY Penny!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Wow!!! Probably the best place we have ever stayed! We have stayed in many hotels like Hyatt, Hilton, and Marriott in places like Grand Cayman, Florida Keys, Orlando, etc., but this place was the best! We stayed in Villa 303 and while it is nicely appointed, the views made this place! Very lush landscape and lots of wildlife on the property. We awoke at 5:45 every morning by the squirrel monkeys jumping on our roof as they made their way down the mountain. They would always stay a while in the trees just downslope of our villa and eat some of the small fruit from that stand of trees. Normally about one to two hours later, the Capuchin monkeys would come through as they made their way up the mountain. We also saw different types of colorful birds, coatis, iguanas, a Jesus Christ lizard, and a skunk. We heard howler monkeys in distance, but never saw any. We liked 303 because it was the closest to the parking lot, so it required the least grueling walk up the mountain (still not for someone that is out of shape or handicapped). Fernando and Kleber, the concierges, were very nice and were very helpful in recommending tours and restaurants.
reviews.title: Simply the BEST place to stay!!!!

likes.liked: — The beautiful views of the landscape and wildlife.
likes.disliked: — Steep walks, but worth it for the views.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just below our villa was the villa pool. It is a very beautiful pool with wild orchids and other lush vegetation all around it. Very tranquil, and nobody was ever in the pool (too many other things to do). The beach was very beautiful as well...not the same as the Caribbean, but beautiful just the same. You do not have the crystal clear water like the Caribbean has, but the mountains, vegetation, and wildlife more than make up for the water clarity! There were never more than about 20 people on the beach, so it felt like you were on a deserted island...very peaceful.
reviews.title: Service Beyond Belief

likes.liked: — The service provided by our concierge.
likes.disliked: — Night club noise on Saturday night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had breakfast at Tule Cafe every morning. It is higher up on the mountain and has a great view as well. The breakfast was great...freshly sliced fruits, fresh squeezed juices, banana bread, fried plantains, and a full egg station for omelets, poached eggs, fried eggs, scrambled eggs, eggs benedict, you name it!
reviews.title: Loved Buena Vista Villas and Casas at Tulemar - First Class

likes.liked: — The house and grounds and beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: While we were in Manuel Antonio, we went sailfishing on the Reel Deal. It was a nice boat - 33' Strike. Fishing was slow, but we did manage to get one sailfish and saw quite a few more. We ended the day fishing inshore and caught quite a few mackerel and jacks.
reviews.title: This place is heaven!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also did a zipline tour with Titi Canopy. They are very good and took great care of our 6 year old daughter so she felt safe.
reviews.title: Best Holiday Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We just returned from a 6 night stay at the Buena Vista Villas (we stayed in one of the 3-bedroom casas)
reviews.title: The good and bad of a great vacation

likes.disliked: — logistics of getting around, no centralized resort services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: First, the positives. The casas are great 3-bedroom, 3 level homes with 3 full bedrooms and 3.5 baths. We were two families (8 people) and fit very comfortably. They are well furnished with good views, a jacuzzi on the deck and full kitchen/living room. They are not for people who do not like steps as there are significant steps in the home.
reviews.title: The Perfect CR Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location is excellent, conveniently located within walking distance to a number of good restaurants and a short cab ride from all of the key activities in the Manuel Antonio area.
reviews.title: Not sure it should be #1

likes.disliked: — The fact that you could feel very isolated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the challenges is that the property is tough to navigate by foot and the shuttles run irregularly which in particular can be a problem when you are down at the beach (really only accessible by shuttle).
reviews.title: Buena Vista at Tulemar Beach is the best of Costa Rica!!!

likes.liked: — We got to stay in a Million Dollar home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was not prepared for the holiday rush and the first day we got to the beach there were no chairs or towels - they finally remedied this but this is certainly less of a resort and more of a complex with nice homes.
reviews.title: Great stay at Buena Vista

aka: Buena Vista Luxury Villas Hotel Manuel Antonio National Park
description: Buena Vista Villas is a small, luxury boutique resort located inside Tulemar, a 33-acre gated resort community. Nestled in the jungle with stunning views, our villas offer luxury and privacy with all the amenities of a high-end beach resort: concierge and daily maid service, three pools and our private sandy beach. Breakfast is available daily at the pool with lunch, snacks and drinks at the beach in the afternoon, among monkeys and sloths.
